line_text: Part, fools!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: What, art thou drawn among these heartless hinds?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Turn thee, Benvolio, look upon thy death.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: I do but keep the peace: put up thy sword,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Or manage it to part these men with me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: What, drawn, and talk of peace! I hate the word,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: As I hate hell, all Montagues, and thee:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Have at thee, coward!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Clubs, bills, and partisans! strike! beat them down!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Down with the Capulets! down with the Montagues!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: What noise is this? Give me my long sword, ho!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: A crutch, a crutch! why call you for a sword?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: My sword, I say! Old Montague is come,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: And flourishes his blade in spite of me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Thou villain Capulet,--Hold me not, let me go.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Thou shalt not stir a foot to seek a foe.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Rebellious subjects, enemies to peace,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Profaners of this neighbour-stained steel,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Will they not hear? What, ho! you men, you beasts,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: That quench the fire of your pernicious rage
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: With purple fountains issuing from your veins,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: On pain of torture, from those bloody hands
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Throw your mistemper'd weapons to the ground,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: And hear the sentence of your moved prince.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Three civil brawls, bred of an airy word,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: By thee, old Capulet, and Montague,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Have thrice disturb'd the quiet of our streets,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: And made Verona's ancient citizens
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Cast by their grave beseeming ornaments,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: To wield old partisans, in hands as old,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Canker'd with peace, to part your canker'd hate:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: If ever you disturb our streets again,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Your lives shall pay the forfeit of the peace.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: For this time, all the rest depart away:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: You Capulet; shall go along with me:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: And, Montague, come you this afternoon,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: To know our further pleasure in this case,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: To old Free-town, our common judgment-place.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Once more, on pain of death, all men depart.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Who set this ancient quarrel new abroach?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Speak, nephew, were you by when it began?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Here were the servants of your adversary,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: And yours, close fighting ere I did approach:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: I drew to part them: in the instant came
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: The fiery Tybalt, with his sword prepared,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Which, as he breathed defiance to my ears,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: He swung about his head and cut the winds,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Who nothing hurt withal hiss'd him in scorn:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: While we were interchanging thrusts and blows,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Came more and more and fought on part and part,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Till the prince came, who parted either part.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: O, where is Romeo? saw you him to-day?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Right glad I am he was not at this fray.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Madam, an hour before the worshipp'd sun
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Peer'd forth the golden window of the east,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: A troubled mind drave me to walk abroad;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Where, underneath the grove of sycamore
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: That westward rooteth from the city's side,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: So early walking did I see your son:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Towards him I made, but he was ware of me
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: And stole into the covert of the wood:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: I, measuring his affections by my own,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: That most are busied when they're most alone,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Pursued my humour not pursuing his,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: And gladly shunn'd who gladly fled from me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Many a morning hath he there been seen,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: With tears augmenting the fresh morning dew.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Adding to clouds more clouds with his deep sighs;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: But all so soon as the all-cheering sun
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Should in the furthest east begin to draw
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: The shady curtains from Aurora's bed,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Away from the light steals home my heavy son,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: And private in his chamber pens himself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Shuts up his windows, locks far daylight out
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: And makes himself an artificial night:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Black and portentous must this humour prove,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Unless good counsel may the cause remove.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: My noble uncle, do you know the cause?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: I neither know it nor can learn of him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Have you importuned him by any means?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Both by myself and many other friends:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: But he, his own affections' counsellor,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Is to himself--I will not say how true--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: But to himself so secret and so close,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: So far from sounding and discovery,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: As is the bud bit with an envious worm,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Ere he can spread his sweet leaves to the air,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Or dedicate his beauty to the sun.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Could we but learn from whence his sorrows grow.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: We would as willingly give cure as know.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: See, where he comes: so please you, step aside;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: I'll know his grievance, or be much denied.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: I would thou wert so happy by thy stay,

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Alas, that love, so gentle in his view,

line_text: Should be so tyrannous and rough in proof!

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: Should, without eyes, see pathways to his will!

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: In sadness, cousin, I do love a woman.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: I aim'd so near, when I supposed you loved.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

line_text: A right good mark-man! And she's fair I love.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Verona. A public place.

play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Welcome, then.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: O holy friar, O, tell me, holy friar,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Where is my lady's lord, where's Romeo?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: There on the ground, with his own tears made drunk.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: O, he is even in my mistress' case,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Just in her case! O woful sympathy!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Piteous predicament! Even so lies she,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Blubbering and weeping, weeping and blubbering.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Stand up, stand up; stand, and you be a man:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: For Juliet's sake, for her sake, rise and stand;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Why should you fall into so deep an O?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Nurse!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Ah sir! ah sir! Well, death's the end of all.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Spakest thou of Juliet? how is it with her?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Doth she not think me an old murderer,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Now I have stain'd the childhood of our joy
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: With blood removed but little from her own?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Where is she? and how doth she? and what says
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: My conceal'd lady to our cancell'd love?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: O, she says nothing, sir, but weeps and weeps;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And now falls on her bed; and then starts up,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And Tybalt calls; and then on Romeo cries,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And then down falls again.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: As if that name,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Shot from the deadly level of a gun,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Did murder her; as that name's cursed hand
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Murder'd her kinsman. O, tell me, friar, tell me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: In what vile part of this anatomy
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Doth my name lodge? tell me, that I may sack
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: The hateful mansion.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Hold thy desperate hand:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Art thou a man? thy form cries out thou art:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Thy tears are womanish; thy wild acts denote
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: The unreasonable fury of a beast:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Unseemly woman in a seeming man!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Or ill-beseeming beast in seeming both!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Thou hast amazed me: by my holy order,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: I thought thy disposition better temper'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Hast thou slain Tybalt? wilt thou slay thyself?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And stay thy lady too that lives in thee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: By doing damned hate upon thyself?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Why rail'st thou on thy birth, the heaven, and earth?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Since birth, and heaven, and earth, all three do meet
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: In thee at once; which thou at once wouldst lose.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Fie, fie, thou shamest thy shape, thy love, thy wit;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Which, like a usurer, abound'st in all,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And usest none in that true use indeed
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Which should bedeck thy shape, thy love, thy wit:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Thy noble shape is but a form of wax,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Digressing from the valour of a man;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Thy dear love sworn but hollow perjury,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Killing that love which thou hast vow'd to cherish;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Thy wit, that ornament to shape and love,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Misshapen in the conduct of them both,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Like powder in a skitless soldier's flask,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Is set afire by thine own ignorance,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And thou dismember'd with thine own defence.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: What, rouse thee, man! thy Juliet is alive,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: For whose dear sake thou wast but lately dead;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: There art thou happy: Tybalt would kill thee,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: But thou slew'st Tybalt; there are thou happy too:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: The law that threaten'd death becomes thy friend
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And turns it to exile; there art thou happy:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: A pack of blessings lights up upon thy back;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Happiness courts thee in her best array;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: But, like a misbehaved and sullen wench,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Thou pout'st upon thy fortune and thy love:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Take heed, take heed, for such die miserable.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Go, get thee to thy love, as was decreed,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Ascend her chamber, hence and comfort her:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: But look thou stay not till the watch be set,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: For then thou canst not pass to Mantua;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Where thou shalt live, till we can find a time
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: To blaze your marriage, reconcile your friends,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Beg pardon of the prince, and call thee back
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: With twenty hundred thousand times more joy
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Than thou went'st forth in lamentation.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Go before, nurse: commend me to thy lady;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And bid her hasten all the house to bed,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Which heavy sorrow makes them apt unto:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Romeo is coming.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: O Lord, I could have stay'd here all the night
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: To hear good counsel: O, what learning is!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: My lord, I'll tell my lady you will come.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Do so, and bid my sweet prepare to chide.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Here, sir, a ring she bid me give you, sir:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Hie you, make haste, for it grows very late.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: How well my comfort is revived by this!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Go hence; good night; and here stands all your state:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Either be gone before the watch be set,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Or by the break of day disguised from hence:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Sojourn in Mantua; I'll find out your man,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And he shall signify from time to time
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Every good hap to you that chances here:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Give me thy hand; 'tis late: farewell; good night.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: But that a joy past joy calls out on me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: It were a grief, so brief to part with thee: Farewell.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Things have fall'n out, sir, so unluckily,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: That we have had no time to move our daughter:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Look you, she loved her kinsman Tybalt dearly,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: And so did I:--Well, we were born to die.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: 'Tis very late, she'll not come down to-night:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: I promise you, but for your company,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: I would have been a-bed an hour ago.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: These times of woe afford no time to woo.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Madam, good night: commend me to your daughter.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: I will, and know her mind early to-morrow;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: To-night she is mew'd up to her heaviness.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Sir Paris, I will make a desperate tender
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Of my child's love: I think she will be ruled
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: In all respects by me; nay, more, I doubt it not.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Wife, go you to her ere you go to bed;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Acquaint her here of my son Paris' love;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: And bid her, mark you me, on Wednesday next--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: But, soft! what day is this?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Monday, my lord,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Monday! ha, ha! Well, Wednesday is too soon,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: O' Thursday let it be: o' Thursday, tell her,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: She shall be married to this noble earl.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Will you be ready? do you like this haste?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: We'll keep no great ado,--a friend or two;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: For, hark you, Tybalt being slain so late,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: It may be thought we held him carelessly,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Being our kinsman, if we revel much:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Therefore we'll have some half a dozen friends,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: And there an end. But what say you to Thursday?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: My lord, I would that Thursday were to-morrow.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Well get you gone: o' Thursday be it, then.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Go you to Juliet ere you go to bed,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Prepare her, wife, against this wedding-day.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Farewell, my lord. Light to my chamber, ho!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Afore me! it is so very very late,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: That we may call it early by and by.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Good night.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  A room in Capulet's house.

line_text: Wilt thou be gone? it is not yet near day:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: It was the nightingale, and not the lark,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: That pierced the fearful hollow of thine ear;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Nightly she sings on yon pomegranate-tree:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Believe me, love, it was the nightingale.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: It was the lark, the herald of the morn,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: No nightingale: look, love, what envious streaks
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Do lace the severing clouds in yonder east:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Night's candles are burnt out, and jocund day
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Stands tiptoe on the misty mountain tops.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: I must be gone and live, or stay and die.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Yon light is not day-light, I know it, I:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: It is some meteor that the sun exhales,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: To be to thee this night a torch-bearer,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And light thee on thy way to Mantua:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Therefore stay yet; thou need'st not to be gone.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Let me be ta'en, let me be put to death;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: I am content, so thou wilt have it so.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: I'll say yon grey is not the morning's eye,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: 'Tis but the pale reflex of Cynthia's brow;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Nor that is not the lark, whose notes do beat
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: The vaulty heaven so high above our heads:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: I have more care to stay than will to go:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Come, death, and welcome! Juliet wills it so.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: How is't, my soul? let's talk; it is not day.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: It is, it is: hie hence, be gone, away!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: It is the lark that sings so out of tune,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Straining harsh discords and unpleasing sharps.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Some say the lark makes sweet division;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: This doth not so, for she divideth us:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Some say the lark and loathed toad change eyes,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: O, now I would they had changed voices too!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Since arm from arm that voice doth us affray,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Hunting thee hence with hunt's-up to the day,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: O, now be gone; more light and light it grows.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: More light and light; more dark and dark our woes!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Madam!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Nurse?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Your lady mother is coming to your chamber:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: The day is broke; be wary, look about.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Then, window, let day in, and let life out.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Farewell, farewell! one kiss, and I'll descend.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Art thou gone so? love, lord, ay, husband, friend!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: I must hear from thee every day in the hour,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: For in a minute there are many days:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: O, by this count I shall be much in years
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Ere I again behold my Romeo!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Farewell!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: I will omit no opportunity
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: That may convey my greetings, love, to thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: O think'st thou we shall ever meet again?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: I doubt it not; and all these woes shall serve
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: For sweet discourses in our time to come.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: O God, I have an ill-divining soul!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Methinks I see thee, now thou art below,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: As one dead in the bottom of a tomb:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Either my eyesight fails, or thou look'st pale.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And trust me, love, in my eye so do you:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Dry sorrow drinks our blood. Adieu, adieu!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: O fortune, fortune! all men call thee fickle:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: If thou art fickle, what dost thou with him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: That is renown'd for faith? Be fickle, fortune;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: For then, I hope, thou wilt not keep him long,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: But send him back.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Who is't that calls? is it my lady mother?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Is she not down so late, or up so early?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: What unaccustom'd cause procures her hither?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Why, how now, Juliet!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Madam, I am not well.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Evermore weeping for your cousin's death?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: What, wilt thou wash him from his grave with tears?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: An if thou couldst, thou couldst not make him live;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Therefore, have done: some grief shows much of love;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: But much of grief shows still some want of wit.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Yet let me weep for such a feeling loss.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: So shall you feel the loss, but not the friend
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Which you weep for.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Feeling so the loss,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Cannot choose but ever weep the friend.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Well, girl, thou weep'st not so much for his death,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: As that the villain lives which slaughter'd him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: What villain madam?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: That same villain, Romeo.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: If, rather than to marry County Paris,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Thou hast the strength of will to slay thyself,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Then is it likely thou wilt undertake
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: A thing like death to chide away this shame,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: That copest with death himself to scape from it:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And, if thou darest, I'll give thee remedy.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: O, bid me leap, rather than marry Paris,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: From off the battlements of yonder tower;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Or walk in thievish ways; or bid me lurk
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Where serpents are; chain me with roaring bears;

line_text: Or shut me nightly in a charnel-house,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: O'er-cover'd quite with dead men's rattling bones,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: With reeky shanks and yellow chapless skulls;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Or bid me go into a new-made grave
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And hide me with a dead man in his shroud;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Things that, to hear them told, have made me tremble;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And I will do it without fear or doubt,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: To live an unstain'd wife to my sweet love.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Hold, then; go home, be merry, give consent
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: To marry Paris: Wednesday is to-morrow:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: To-morrow night look that thou lie alone;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Let not thy nurse lie with thee in thy chamber:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Take thou this vial, being then in bed,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And this distilled liquor drink thou off;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: When presently through all thy veins shall run
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: A cold and drowsy humour, for no pulse
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Shall keep his native progress, but surcease:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: No warmth, no breath, shall testify thou livest;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: The roses in thy lips and cheeks shall fade
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: To paly ashes, thy eyes' windows fall,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Like death, when he shuts up the day of life;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Each part, deprived of supple government,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Shall, stiff and stark and cold, appear like death:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And in this borrow'd likeness of shrunk death
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Thou shalt continue two and forty hours,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And then awake as from a pleasant sleep.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Now, when the bridegroom in the morning comes
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: To rouse thee from thy bed, there art thou dead:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Then, as the manner of our country is,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: In thy best robes uncover'd on the bier
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Thou shalt be borne to that same ancient vault
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Where all the kindred of the Capulets lie.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: In the mean time, against thou shalt awake,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Shall Romeo by my letters know our drift,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And hither shall he come: and he and I
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Will watch thy waking, and that very night
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Shall Romeo bear thee hence to Mantua.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And this shall free thee from this present shame;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: If no inconstant toy, nor womanish fear,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Abate thy valour in the acting it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Give me, give me! O, tell not me of fear!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Hold; get you gone, be strong and prosperous
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: In this resolve: I'll send a friar with speed
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: To Mantua, with my letters to thy lord.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Love give me strength! and strength shall help afford.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Farewell, dear father!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: So many guests invite as here are writ.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Sirrah, go hire me twenty cunning cooks.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: You shall have none ill, sir; for I'll try if they
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: can lick their fingers.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: How canst thou try them so?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Marry, sir, 'tis an ill cook that cannot lick his
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: own fingers: therefore he that cannot lick his
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: fingers goes not with me.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Go, be gone.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: We shall be much unfurnished for this time.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: What, is my daughter gone to Friar Laurence?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Ay, forsooth.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Well, he may chance to do some good on her:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: A peevish self-will'd harlotry it is.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: See where she comes from shrift with merry look.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: How now, my headstrong! where have you been gadding?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Where I have learn'd me to repent the sin
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Of disobedient opposition
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: To you and your behests, and am enjoin'd
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: By holy Laurence to fall prostrate here,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: And beg your pardon: pardon, I beseech you!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Henceforward I am ever ruled by you.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Send for the county; go tell him of this:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: I'll have this knot knit up to-morrow morning.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: I met the youthful lord at Laurence' cell;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: And gave him what becomed love I might,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Not step o'er the bounds of modesty.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Why, I am glad on't; this is well: stand up:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: This is as't should be. Let me see the county;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Ay, marry, go, I say, and fetch him hither.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Now, afore God! this reverend holy friar,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Our whole city is much bound to him.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Nurse, will you go with me into my closet,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: To help me sort such needful ornaments
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: As you think fit to furnish me to-morrow?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: No, not till Thursday; there is time enough.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Go, nurse, go with her: we'll to church to-morrow.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: We shall be short in our provision:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: 'Tis now near night.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Tush, I will stir about,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: And all things shall be well, I warrant thee, wife:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Go thou to Juliet, help to deck up her;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: I'll not to bed to-night; let me alone;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: I'll play the housewife for this once. What, ho!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: They are all forth. Well, I will walk myself

scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: To County Paris, to prepare him up
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Against to-morrow: my heart is wondrous light,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Since this same wayward girl is so reclaim'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Ay, those attires are best: but, gentle nurse,

line_text: I pray thee, leave me to myself to-night,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: For I have need of many orisons
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: To move the heavens to smile upon my state,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Which, well thou know'st, is cross, and full of sin.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: What, are you busy, ho? need you my help?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: No, madam; we have cull'd such necessaries
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: As are behoveful for our state to-morrow:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: So please you, let me now be left alone,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And let the nurse this night sit up with you;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: For, I am sure, you have your hands full all,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: In this so sudden business.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Good night:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Get thee to bed, and rest; for thou hast need.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Farewell! God knows when we shall meet again.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: I have a faint cold fear thrills through my veins,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: That almost freezes up the heat of life:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: I'll call them back again to comfort me:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Nurse! What should she do here?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: My dismal scene I needs must act alone.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Come, vial.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: What if this mixture do not work at all?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Shall I be married then to-morrow morning?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: No, no: this shall forbid it: lie thou there.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: What if it be a poison, which the friar
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Subtly hath minister'd to have me dead,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Lest in this marriage he should be dishonour'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Because he married me before to Romeo?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: I fear it is: and yet, methinks, it should not,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: For he hath still been tried a holy man.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: How if, when I am laid into the tomb,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: I wake before the time that Romeo
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Come to redeem me? there's a fearful point!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Shall I not, then, be stifled in the vault,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: To whose foul mouth no healthsome air breathes in,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And there die strangled ere my Romeo comes?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Or, if I live, is it not very like,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: The horrible conceit of death and night,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Together with the terror of the place,--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: As in a vault, an ancient receptacle,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Where, for these many hundred years, the bones
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Of all my buried ancestors are packed:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Where bloody Tybalt, yet but green in earth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Lies festering in his shroud; where, as they say,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: At some hours in the night spirits resort;--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Alack, alack, is it not like that I,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: So early waking, what with loathsome smells,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And shrieks like mandrakes' torn out of the earth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: That living mortals, hearing them, run mad:--
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: O, if I wake, shall I not be distraught,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Environed with all these hideous fears?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And madly play with my forefather's joints?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And pluck the mangled Tybalt from his shroud?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: And, in this rage, with some great kinsman's bone,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: As with a club, dash out my desperate brains?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: O, look! methinks I see my cousin's ghost
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Seeking out Romeo, that did spit his body
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Upon a rapier's point: stay, Tybalt, stay!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Romeo, I come! this do I drink to thee.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet

line_text: Hold, take these keys, and fetch more spices, nurse.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: They call for dates and quinces in the pastry.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Come, stir, stir, stir! the second cock hath crow'd,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: The curfew-bell hath rung, 'tis three o'clock:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Look to the baked meats, good Angelica:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Spare not for the cost.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Go, you cot-quean, go,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Get you to bed; faith, You'll be sick to-morrow
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: For this night's watching.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: No, not a whit: what! I have watch'd ere now
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: All night for lesser cause, and ne'er been sick.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Ay, you have been a mouse-hunt in your time;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: But I will watch you from such watching now.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: A jealous hood, a jealous hood!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Now, fellow,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: What's there?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Things for the cook, sir; but I know not what.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Make haste, make haste.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Sirrah, fetch drier logs:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Call Peter, he will show thee where they are.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: I have a head, sir, that will find out logs,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: And never trouble Peter for the matter.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Mass, and well said; a merry whoreson, ha!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Thou shalt be logger-head. Good faith, 'tis day:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: The county will be here with music straight,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: For so he said he would: I hear him near.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Nurse! Wife! What, ho! What, nurse, I say!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Go waken Juliet, go and trim her up;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: I'll go and chat with Paris: hie, make haste,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Make haste; the bridegroom he is come already:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Make haste, I say.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Hall in Capulet's house.

line_text: Mistress! what, mistress! Juliet! fast, I warrant her, she:

line_text: Came I to take her from her kindred's vault;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Meaning to keep her closely at my cell,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Till I conveniently could send to Romeo:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: But when I came, some minute ere the time
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Of her awaking, here untimely lay
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: The noble Paris and true Romeo dead.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: She wakes; and I entreated her come forth,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: And bear this work of heaven with patience:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: But then a noise did scare me from the tomb;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: And she, too desperate, would not go with me,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: But, as it seems, did violence on herself.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: All this I know; and to the marriage
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Her nurse is privy: and, if aught in this
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Miscarried by my fault, let my old life
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Be sacrificed, some hour before his time,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Unto the rigour of severest law.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: We still have known thee for a holy man.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Where's Romeo's man? what can he say in this?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: I brought my master news of Juliet's death;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: And then in post he came from Mantua
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: To this same place, to this same monument.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: This letter he early bid me give his father,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: And threatened me with death, going in the vault,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: I departed not and left him there.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Give me the letter; I will look on it.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Where is the county's page, that raised the watch?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Sirrah, what made your master in this place?
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: He came with flowers to strew his lady's grave;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: And bid me stand aloof, and so I did:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Anon comes one with light to ope the tomb;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: And by and by my master drew on him;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: And then I ran away to call the watch.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: This letter doth make good the friar's words,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Their course of love, the tidings of her death:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: And here he writes that he did buy a poison
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Of a poor 'pothecary, and therewithal
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Came to this vault to die, and lie with Juliet.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Where be these enemies? Capulet! Montague!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: See, what a scourge is laid upon your hate,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: That heaven finds means to kill your joys with love.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: And I for winking at your discords too
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Have lost a brace of kinsmen: all are punish'd.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: O brother Montague, give me thy hand:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: This is my daughter's jointure, for no more
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Can I demand.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: But I can give thee more:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: For I will raise her statue in pure gold;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: That while Verona by that name is known,
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: There shall no figure at such rate be set
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: As that of true and faithful Juliet.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: As rich shall Romeo's by his lady's lie;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Poor sacrifices of our enmity!
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: A glooming peace this morning with it brings;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: The sun, for sorrow, will not show his head:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Go hence, to have more talk of these sad things;
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Some shall be pardon'd, and some punished:
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: For never was a story of more woe
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.

line_text: Than this of Juliet and her Romeo.
play_title_long: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
scene_title: SCENE III.  A churchyard; in it a tomb belonging to the Capulets.
